item.title: Speed change at fixed true wind
item.description: Change of speed with real wind fixed # Adjusting the sails in case of speed change # We consider a steady current wind and a steady true wind. item.title: Wind Gusts
item.description: Passing a reef # A reef is an increase in the actual wind. This chart can be taken the other way around for the passage of a squall (but we try to avoid them). A strengthening wind (while remaining stable in direction) makes the apparent wind increase. The boat’s objective is to take the most direct route. Upwind Increasing force: You shock a little - You maintain the course - bends.
